Key Match Events: CJ Abrams hit a home run
Jake Irvin gave up one run and two hits in six innings
Others: Atlanta Braves fell one game behind the Mets in the race for the third NL wild card
Max Fried kept his team close
Jake Irvin held the Braves hitless for 5 2/3 innings
Michael Harris II lined a double to the right-center field wall for the Braves’ first hit with two outs in the top of the sixth
Dylan Crews added a pair of hits for Washington, including a run-scoring single, breaking an 0-for-10 slump
James Wood’s on-base streak reached a career-high 12 games with two singles and an RBI
Others (continued): Atlanta managed to get a baserunner into scoring position in the seventh and eighth innings with one out, but was not able to push a run across, going 1 for 7 on the night
